meanings.definition: A person who behaves obsequiously to those in power.
meanings.sent1: The lickspits always agreed with the boss, hoping for a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was known as a lickspits because he always flattered the manager.
meanings.sent3: The lickspits in the office even complimented the boss's terrible tie.
meanings.sent4: She was such a lickspits, she would do anything to please her superiors.
meanings.sent5: The lickspits's constant praise made everyone roll their eyes.

meanings.definition: To behave obsequiously to those in power.
meanings.sent1: He would lickspits around the CEO, hoping for a raise.
meanings.sent2: She decided to lickspits to her supervisor in order to get a day off.
meanings.sent3: The employee had to lickspits to the manager to get the project approved.
meanings.sent4: The politician would lickspits to the lobbyists for campaign donations.
meanings.sent5: The student tried to lickspits to the teacher for a better grade.
